greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f.: imaginary part of 1/(1 - i*x - i*x^2) where i=sqrt(-1).
comment: The norm of the coefficients in 1/(1 - i*x - i*x^2) is given by A105309.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,-1,-2,-1).
formula: a(n) = A201837(n-1) + A201837(n-2), where A201837 gives the real part of the coefficients in 1/(1 - i*x - i*x^2).
a(n) = Im((((i + sqrt(4*i-1))^(n+1) - (i - sqrt(4*i-1))^(n+1)))/(2^(n+1)*sqrt(4*i-1))), where i=sqrt(-1). - _Daniel Suteu_, Apr 20 2018
example: A201837 gives the real part of coefficients in 1/(1 - i*x - i*x^2) and begins: 1, 0, -1, -2, 0, 4, 5, -2, -13, -12, 12, 40, 25, -52, -117, -38, 196, 324,... in which the pairwise sums generate this sequence.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 06 2011
